definition: to make oneself do sth in spite of adversity, pain etc
to support/to prop up/to push or move with a pole/to maintain/to open or unfurl/to fill to bursting point/brace/stay/support

sentences.english: I don't think you wanna go on.
sentences.chinese: 估計你也不想再硬撐下去了。

sentences.english: The staff should have taken a rest at home when he was sick. No need drag himself to work.
sentences.chinese: 員工生病了就應該在家休息，不必硬撐着去上班。

sentences.english: There are some companies, although still" alive ", but also relinquish its hard-bound .
sentences.chinese: 還有一些企業，雖然還“活着”，但也是在硬撐。

sentences.english: Way on the face very hard time, but also hard support.
sentences.chinese: 路子面子上很過不去，卻還硬撐着。

sentences.english: Don't confront the situation if you don't feel you can keep your cool.
sentences.chinese: 在無法保持冷靜的情況下不要硬撐場面。

definition: to blab/to shoot one's mouth off/to commit a gaffe
to lose one's cool/to get impatient/unable to remain calm
lit. chickens flying and dogs jumping (idiom)/fig. in chaos/in disarray
to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
to push oneself forward/to seek fame/to be in the limelight/same as 出鋒頭|出锋头[chu1 feng1 tou5]
to shout and scream (idiom); to kick up a fuss/to make a scene
lit. the soul of a deceased has not yet dispersed (idiom)/fig. the influence still lingers on/the spirit (of some doctrine) is still alive
unable to sit or stand still (out of nervousness etc) (idiom)
lit. spouting smoke through the seven orifices (idiom)/fig. to seethe with anger
covered all over with cuts and bruises/beaten black and blue/be a mass of bruises
